text: Here's how to change your Gmail password.
Go to the Gmail log-in screen
and type in your account name.
Tap "Forgot password?"

If you remember a previous
password, type that in.
If it's correct, you'll be able
to sign in and change your password.
If it's incorrect
or if you hit "Try another way,"
you'll trigger Google's authentication.
If you have a backup account set up,
you'll get a confirmation code there.
Press "Send."
If you don't receive a notification
or want to use a different method,

click "Try another way" again,
at the bottom of the screen.
When using your phone number,

you can choose to get your
code over a text or a call.
Plug in the code and follow the prompts
to reset your password.

If you don't have a phone
number attached to the account,

you'll need to click "Try
another way" a third time.

Enter an email address
you do have access to.

Google will review the
issue within a few days.

This method does not
guarantee account access
so you can change your password.
